Expressways Save Travel Time

Expressway Capacity Endures
The capacity of many fine highways has, over a period of years, been
materially reduced through commercial development of adjacent proper-
ties. Several striking examples are familiar to every Baltimorean, notably
the Ritchie Highway and Route 1 between Baltimore and Washington.
Through this process public funds invested for the purpose of moving
Expressways save travel time, first because they permit vehicles to
travel safely at higher speeds, and secondly because vehicles can proceed
continuously without the frequent stops required for intersections on con-
ventional city streets. Dramatic examples of time savings are available
considerably more.

traffic have been in good part lost. Expressways, through complete access
from a number of cities with expressways. On the average it can be said

that the time saving is at least 50%, and in congested central areas often

control, are inherently free from commercial encroachment and develop-
ment. The original capacity will endure.

Expressways Can Reduce Blight

It is unlikely that expressways can ever provide a complete answer
